abstract: Vic Miles, one of the first black television reporters in New York who served as anchorman on New York's WCBS-TV/Channel 2 for 24 years, dies at age 79.
snippet: Mr. Miles brought a no-nonsense, get-to-the-essence style to his 24 years as a reporter and anchorman for WCBS-TV/Channel 2 in New York and was among the first black television reporters in the city.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Miles brought a no-nonsense, get-to-the-essence style to his 24 years as a reporter and anchorman for WCBS-TV/Channel 2 in New York and was among the first black television reporters in the city.

headline.main: Vic Miles, Reporter and Anchor on WCBS-TV, Dies at 79
headline.print_headline: Vic Miles, 79, Reporter And Anchor on WCBS-TV
